item.title: Italy's problems were highlighted against Argentina but Luigi Di Biagio will not be the man to fix them as Carlo Ancelotti, Antonio Conte and Roberto Mancini are in the running to fill void
item.description: SHERIDAN BIRD IN ITALY: The honeymoon, in Manchester, lasted around 45 minute as Luigi Di Biagio's debut as Italy coach produced an underwhelming 2-0 defeat against Argentina.
item.content:encoded:
The honeymoon, in Manchester, lasted around 45 minutes. Luigi Di Biagio's debut as Italy coach produced an underwhelming 2-0 defeat against Argentina and prompted a slew of doubts over his suitability for the role.

The ex-midfielder was promoted from Under 21 boss to the full team for the two friendlies against Argentina and England. 

The South Americans, without the rested Lionel Messi, made light work of the goal-shy Azzurri. Di Biagio had been given generous coverage in the build-up, but the loss dented optimism.

Luigi Di Biagio is pictured at Wembley Stadium as his Italy side look around England's ground

Di Biagio addresses the media alongside Italy and AC Milan defender Leonardo Bonucci

Caretaker head coach Di Biagio speaks to legendary goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon on Sunday

Italy's next full-time coach will be announced on May 20. The favourites are Carlo Ancelotti, Antonio Conte and Roberto Mancini. Claudio Ranieri is a dark horse. But few reporters are giving Di Biagio a chance of keeping the job, even if he masterminds a win at Wembley.

The task facing Di Biagio was always daunting. As soon as Italy failed to qualify for the World Cup, dramatic cries of 'revolution' filled the gloomy air. Everyone from fans to press demanded a fresh start and the changing of the guard.

But Di Biagio, and anyone within the game, knew that you can't axe a squad overnight. Some retired, like Daniele de Rossi, others, like Gianluigi Buffon will probably bow out after these friendlies. But Leonardo Bonucci, Ciro Immobile, Jorginho, Alessandro Florenzi, Andrea Belotti, Marco Verratti and Lorenzo Insigne still have a future in blue.

In these two games Di Biagio is trying to usher in young talent like Fiorentina winger Federico Chiesa and AC Milan striker Patrick Cutrone, but also select enough of the established side to avoid embarrassing defeats. 

Some goals would help too. After the blank against Argentina, Italy haven't scored in three games. They have only found the net three times in the last 630 minutes.

But Di Biagio is a strong character, and overcame adversity in his playing career. Most notably in the Italy shirt. A tenacious and courageous central midfielder, Di Biagio missed a penalty in the shootout against France in the quarter-final of the 1998 World Cup.

Walking up to the ball he was confident in his ability to score, having converted a dozen in training the day before. But his shot cannoned off Fabien Barthez's bar, and Italy were out. The Azzurri gave France the hardest match of that tournament, but it was in vain.

Di Biagio had his redemption though. In another match against the hosts, this time the Euro 2000 semi-final against Netherlands, spot-kicks were required to find a winner. 

Antonio Conte (left) and Carlo Ancelotti (right) are both in the running to take up the Italy role

Buffon looks set bow out of Italy duty after Tuesday night's match against England at Wembley

Italy have lost several big name players but they have talented stars like Andrea Belotti (left)

Italy were beaten 2-0 by Argentina despite Lionel Messi and Sergio Aguero being in the stands

'I wasn't supposed to take a penalty, but [Alessandro] Del Piero and [Filippo] Inzaghi had gone off during the game. The boss, Dino Zoff, asked me to take a penalty, and despite my fear and uncertainty, I didn't think about saying "no" for a second. This time it went well.' Di Biagio told the Italy team's YouTube channel.

A reliable player with hometown club Roma, Inter and then Brescia, Di Biagio began his coaching career in 2008. Three years later he entered the national team system, taking over the Under 20s. Making impressive progress, Di Biagio became Under 21 coach in 2013.

The 46-year-old guided Italy's youngsters in two European Championships. In the first of those tournaments his side faced England, led by Gareth Southgate. The match finished 3-1 to Italy. Last year the Azzurri reached the competition's semi-finals, losing to a brilliant Spain.

Then came the senior side's Armageddon against Sweden, and the resignation of coach Giampiero Ventura. An interim boss was needed, and Di Biagio seemed the obvious solution. Although not for everyone.

Claudio Gentile, ferocious right back of Italy's 1982 World Cup winning team, and a former U21 coach himself, told Radio Sportiva: 'It looks to me that there aren't any good options. Di Biagio failed with the Under 21s, a side with six players from the senior team, after he'd said it was the best Under 21 group for 20 years. I don't think he's earned this opportunity.'

Di Biagio (No 14) played alongside the likes of Filippo Inzaghi (No 9) and Paolo Maldini (No 3) during his time as an international player with Italy

Di Biagio falls on his back after missing a penalty in the quarter-final shootout against France at the 1998 World Cup

Others have been more encouraging. Gazzetta dello Sport's Sebastiano Vernazza wrote 'if this is 'year zero' for Italy, it's right to press 'reset', like coach Fulvio Bernardini did after the disaster at World Cup 1974, and Azeglio Vicini did after Mexico '86. 

The fewer players from the play-off against Sweden there are at Wembley, the more Italy can bring in the future. Be bold, Di Biagio.'

In what could be his final game in charge, Di Biagio could move from a 4-3-3 to a 4-2-3-1, with Atalanta's revelation Bryan Cristante in the No 10 role. Cristante, 23, was once considered the next big thing at Milan, making his debut in the Champions League aged 16. But his habit of taking too many touches slowed him down and he slipped out of contention, joining Benfica.

But now he has been revived by wily Atalanta coach Gian Piero Gasperini, and scored 11 goals this season. Midfield will be a pressing issue for the next Italy coach. Jorginho of Napoli has tremendous quality, but is yet to shine for the Azzurri.

Then there is the eternal promise of Marco Verratti. On the scene since 2014, the PSG player is confident and has got the ability to be the fulcrum of the national side. But a combination of injuries and indiscipline have stunted his development.

At 25, Verratti has time on his side, but the sooner the national team can find the best way to use him, the better. His persistence, agility and energy are formidable and he is blatantly capable of more than he has shown in his 25 appearances so far.

Far from a meaningless friendly, Tuesday night's game is an opportunity for several players to stake their claim. And if it is Luigi Di Biagio's last match, he'll want to go out with a bang, at the very least a goal.

item.title: Davide Astori will remain in FIFA 18 Ultimate Team but his price has been locked to stop people from cashing in
item.description: EA Sports have confirmed that late Italy and Fiorentina defender, Davide Astori, will remain in FIFA 18 at the request of Fiorentina. Fans had pressured EA to remove him as some tried to profit.
item.content:encoded:
EA Sports have confirmed that late Italy and Fiorentina defender, Davide Astori, will remain in FIFA 18 at the request of Fiorentina.

When loading up the game, a message appears from EA that gives condolences to the friends and family of the defender as well as the actions they are taking with his card.

Fans had pressured EA to remove Astori from the game after heartless players tried to cash in on his death by charging ridiculous amounts for his Ultimate Team card. While he will remain in the game, EA have taken steps to stop this from happening.

Scroll down for video 

EA Sports have confirmed the late Davide Astori will remain in FIFA 18 after he passed away

Fiorentina requested he remained in the game despite some players using him to make a profit

The statement revealed that Astori has been removed from Ultimate Team packs, meaning the transfer market will be the only way fans can get hold of the player.

And to stop people from ramming his price up to try and make a profit, EA have significantly reduced the maximum price of his card. 

 It's a welcome change that will allow FIFA players to make their own small tributes to the defender in the game while stopping others from heartlessly taking advantage.

The former Fiorentina captain passed away at just 31-years old of a 'cardiac arrest by natural causes' on March 4 in the hotel that the team were staying in - leaving behind his wife and two-year old daughter.

Thousands attended the defender's funeral and the club have since retired his number 13 shirt.

item.title: Sandown swansong earmarked for popular chaser Cue Card
item.description: Cue Card will end his career on the final day of the jumps season at Sandown on April 28.Trainer Colin Tizzard and owner Jean Bishop had been in discussions
item.content:encoded:
Cue Card will end his career on the final day of the jumps season at Sandown on April 28.

Trainer Colin Tizzard and owner Jean Bishop had been in discussions over whether to bid for one more Grade One triumph in the Melling Chase at Aintree or the Grade Two bet365 Oaksey Chase at the Esher circuit.

But Bishop said: 'We decided on Sandown. We just thought it would suit him because it tends to be a small field for that race and it gives him a bit longer with the prospect of some nice ground.

Cue Card will end his career on the final day of the jumps season at Sandown on April 28

'It's the last day of the season, too, so it's a nice place for it all to come to an ending.'

In the four years since its inception, the Oaksey Chase has been won only by the Philip Hobbs-trained Menorah, who himself retired after last season's victory.

Bishop added: 'It's quite fitting he will end in a race that has only been won by Menorah, so far as he had quite a few good races against Menorah. Hopefully it will end the same way for us.

Trainer Colin Tizzard and owner Jean Bishop discussed bid for a last Grade One triumph

'He's been incredible. It makes no difference now but he wasn't even four when he won the Cheltenham Bumper - he was foaled at the end of April.

CUE CARD'S MAJOR WINS 

Champion Bumper - 2010

Haldon Gold Cup - 2012

Ascot Chase - 2013, 2017

Ryanair Chase - 2013

Betfair Chase - 2013, 2015, 2016

Charlie Hall Chase - 2015

King George VI Chase - 2015

Betfred Bowl - 2016 

'Like them all he has had the odd problem in his career, but touch wood, he has come through them all without missing a lot.'

Cue Card's jockey Paddy Brennan tweeted: 'What a day in store @Sandownpark on the 28th of April. One last day out buddy. cuecard legend.'

Earlier this month Cue Card was pulled up in the Ryanair Chase at the Cheltenham Festival, which prompted speculation about its future.

Cue Card has enjoyed much success, including winning the Betfair Chase on three occasions.

item.title: Gamers will play at the French Open as tennis makes its esports debut with a tournament hosted by Roland Garros
item.description: Tennis is the latest sport to host an esports tournament after French Open organisers Roland-Garros announced their first gaming tournament which will take gamers to the French Open.
item.content:encoded:
Tennis is the latest sport to host an esports tournament after French Open organisers Roland Garros announced their first gaming tournament which will give gamers a chance to attend one of the biggest tennis events of the year.

The tournament will be sponsored by the French Open's main partner, multinational banking group BNP Paribas and will appropriately be called the 'Roland-Garros e-series by BNP Paribas.'

Players from the United Kingdom, France, Belgium, Italy, Germany, China, India and Brazil will compete in a demo-version of the unreleased Tennis World Tour game made by Bigben Interactive.

Gamers will compete in the World Tour Tennis game during the French Open later this year

The winner of each region will then travel to the French Open in Paris on May 25 where they will play in the finals of the tournament. With the French Open starting on May 21, the e-series finals will be held during the opening rounds of the tournament.

The e-series is part of a renewed agreement between BNP Paribas and the French Tennis Federation (FFT), according to the Esports Observer, in which the deal will last until 2021.

Tennis is one of the many sports that has started its own esports tournaments, joining the likes of the NBA, NHL as well as football leagues La Liga and Bundesliga.

item.title: Lewis Cook's grandfather set to bank £17,000 should Bournemouth star make his England debut in Italy clash
item.description: Cook did not make an appearance then, but is in line to win his first senior cap when England host Italy in the final friendly before Gareth Southgate names his World Cup squad.
item.content:encoded:
Lewis Cook is in line to make his England debut on Tuesday - and net his grandfather £17,000.

Just a matter of months after leading the Young Lions to Under-20s World Cup glory, the Bournemouth midfielder was drafted into the senior squad for the first time last November.

Cook did not make an appearance then, but is in line to win his first senior cap when England host Italy in the final friendly before Gareth Southgate names his World Cup squad.

Bournemouth midfielder is set to make his grandfather £17,000 richer if he plays for England

As things stand, Cook is set to start on the bench for the Southgate's men, with Jake Livermore tipped to start ahead of him. 

Despite this though, the 21-year-old can still land his grandfather Trevor Burlingham a hefty windfall should come off the bench.

Burlingham placed a £500 bet on his grandson winning a senior Three Lions cap before turning 26. Just 21 and Cook may well make his grandfather a rich man come Tuesday night.

That 2014 bet at 33-1 with William Hill would land Cook's grandfather £17,000 - a good figure but small fry compared to the £125,000 won by Peter Edwards after grandson Harry Wilson made his Wales debut in 2013.

Cook's grandfather bet £500 in 2014 that he would make his debut before reaching 26, and he could complete the bet if he comes off the bench against Italy at Wembley on Tuesday night

item.title: Team Liquid are presented with stunning rings to commemorate their DOTA 2 International 7 victory
item.description: Team Liquid's DOTA 2 team have been presented with stunning rings to celebrate their historic International 7 victory. Valve has presented every winner of every International with a ring.
item.content:encoded:
Team Liquid's DOTA 2 team have been presented with stunning rings to celebrate their historic International 7 victory. Of the tournament's massive $25million (£17m) prize pool, Liquid received just under $11m (£8m) for their win, the highest amount ever won by any esports team.

Valve has presented every winner of the International with a ring since the first of the tournaments in 2011. However, these are not the official rings but rather custom ones presented by the company who owns Liquid, aXiomatic.

The rings, which were ordered from a website called Baron Rings, feature the team's logo on the front with 'World Champions TI 2017 around it and the DOTA 2 logo on the side.

Team Liquid's owners (aXiomatic) have gifted Team Liquid's DOTA 2 team championship rings

All five players, including GH (left), and coach Heen (right) were presented with the rings

Liquid's official rings will be presented to them from Valve just before TI8 begins later this year. Coaches have not been given rings in the past but they play a much bigger role now that they are allowed in the team booths for drafts.

Natus Vincere were the first ever TI champions, followed by Invictus Gaming, Alliance, Newbee, Evil Geniuses and Wings Gaming.

In order: Natus Vincere, Invictus Gaming, Alliance, Newbee, Evil Geniuses and Wings Gaming

Handing out rings like these are common in American sports. The NFL do the same for every player who wins the Super Bowl. The massive rings act as personal trophies for people to keep and display rather than use as a fashion accessory.

And after moving away from putting the DOTA logo on the top of the rings, Valve's version will probably also include the TL logo on the front. They have their work cut out for them though if they want to top this excellent effort by aXiomatic.

item.title: Cricket Australia chief arrives in South Africa as Steve Smith and David Warner face lengthy bans after ball-tampering scandal with coach Darren Lehmann 'set to resign'
item.description: Cricket Australia supremo James Sutherland arrived in South Africa on Tuesday to precipitate an expected dramatic shake up of the Test team in the wake of the weekend's ball-tampering scandal.
item.content:encoded:
Cricket Australia supremo James Sutherland arrived in South Africa on Tuesday to precipitate an expected dramatic shake up of the Test team in the wake of the weekend's ball-tampering scandal and announce punishment for the protagonists.

Australia was plunged into turmoil after captain Steve Smith admitted on Saturday that senior players had conspired with opening batsman Cameron Bancroft to tamper with the ball during the third test against South Africa in Cape Town.

Sutherland, who already asked Smith and David Warner to step down as captain and vice-captain respectively, is expected to come down hard on the team's senior figures after being given a report into the scandal.

Cricket Australia chief James Sutherland arrived in South Africa on Tuesday morning

The Aussie supremo is set to hand out punishments to Steve Smith and David Warner 

The chief executive will hear the outcome of a probe into Saturday's incident from team performance head Pat Howard and integrity chief Iain Roy after the pair spent Monday in Cape Town interviewing the players.

Cricket Australia (CA) will announce the punishments on Tuesday at a news conference in Johannesburg, where the team will arrive earlier in the day to prepare for the fourth Test.

They are expected to announce additional sanctions for captain Smith, who has already been suspended for the fourth Test by the International Cricket Council (ICC) and is expected to head home to Australia in the next few days.

There could also be bans for Warner and other members of the 'leadership group', who Smith admitted had hatched the plan to rough up the ball to obtain extra swing on the third day of the third test.

The position of coach Darren Lehmann also hangs in the balance despite Smith's denial of any involvement by the coach.

Australian coach Darren Lehmann is reportedly set to resign over the ball-tampering affair

Australia admitted to deliberately attempting to change the condition of the ball in Cape Town

Cameron Bancroft was seen running his hand over the ball, before removing a yellow object from his pocket and placing it down the front of his trousers

The former Test batsman clearly played a part in trying to cover up the cheating by getting word to Bancroft that his use of tape to try and scuff up the ball had been spotted by the television cameras.

The Daily Telegraph on Tuesday cited sources as saying Lehmann, who has made no public comment since the incident, planned to pre-empt the investigation by stepping down more than a year ahead of his planned exit after the 2019 Ashes series. 

Smith's predecessor as captain, Michael Clarke, thought Lehmann was damned even if he had not known about the plan to cheat.

'If that's the case, then the Australian head coach hasn't got control of this Australian team,' Clarke said on Channel Nine TV. 'And if he does know about it, then he's as accountable as anybody else.'

Even if Lehmann is cleared of any involvement in the affair, there is clearly a mood in Australia that the standards of behaviour of the national team have dropped too far in the five years of his reign.

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull said on Tuesday he had spoken to Cricket Australia chairman David Peever and demanded swift action on the ball-tampering incident, which he described as a 'shocking affront to Australia' and a 'terrible disgrace'.

Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has waded into the saga once again

Smith (right) is set to lose the captaincy while Bancroft could also be punished for his role 

He also spoke out against the practice of 'sledging' opponents, something Lehmann and his team have defended as part of the game and which had already contributed to a souring of relations with South Africa in this series.

'I think there has to be the strongest action taken against this practice of sledging,' Turnbull told reporters in Canberra.

'It has got right out of control, it should have no place in the game, I want to be very clear about this. The game of cricket should be one that once again is held up as a role model.

'I think that some of the sledging, as some of the shocking conduct that we have seen, is also part of the process of review and reflection that is going to be undertaken.'

Cricket Australia, facing pressure from sponsors and an angry public, have their own code of conduct and the capability to meet out serious sanction, including year-long bans.

The team has remained cloistered in their hotel since Sunday, keeping a stony media silence after losing the third test by 322 runs to go 2-1 down in the four-Test series.

item.title: England will only play one World Cup warm-up match with the tournament ball due to FA agreement with Nike
item.description: It was reported England will use the Nike Ordem V ball in the friendly against Italy at Wembley on Tuesday as part of the FA's contract with their American supplier, which runs until 2030.
item.content:encoded:
England are set to play only one of their three remaining World Cup warm-up matches with the tournament ball because of the Football Association's long-term commitment to Nike.

Several participating nations, including Germany and Spain, have played friendlies with the Adidas Telstar ball that will be used at the June-July tournament in Russia.

However the Times reported that Gareth Southgate's England will use the Nike Ordem V ball in the friendly against Italy at Wembley on Tuesday as part of the FA's contract with their American apparel and ball supplier, which runs until 2030.

England will play only one World Cup warm-up match with the Adidas Telstar tournament ball

Because of the FA's agreement with Nike, England will use the Ordem V (pictured) vs Italy

The Ordem V ball will also be used in England's next warm-up fixture against Nigeria on June 2, but Nike have allowed the FA to test the Adidas ball in the final friendly against Costa Rica on June 7.

It will be the only time the team will get an opportunity to play with the World Cup ball prior to their opening group match in Volgograd on June 18.

In order to mitigate any potential disadvantage, Southgate has given his players as much exposure as possible to the Adidas ball in training.

Gareth Southgate has been using the Telstar in training for his keepers as much as possible

The difference between balls often has the biggest impact on goalkeepers, who need time to adapt to its flight and bounce.

Spanish goalkeeper David de Gea has already criticised the World Cup ball following last week's 1-1 draw against Germany, saying it was hard to grip because it was coated with protective plastic.

Tunisia, Panama and Belgium are England's Group G opponents in Russia. The tournament starts on June 14.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo fails to register a shot for the first time this season in Portugal's 3-0 defeat by Holland
item.description: The Real Madrid star has been in exceptional form of late scoring in his previous nine matches for club and country. Ronald Koeman's side managed to prevent him from having an effort on goal.
item.content:encoded:
Cristiano Ronaldo failed to register a shot for the first time this season in Portugal's 3-0 defeat by Holland in a friendly on Monday.

The Real Madrid star has been in exceptional form of late, scoring in his previous nine matches for club and country.

However, Ronald Koeman's side managed to prevent him from having an effort on goal and secured a comfortable victory.

Cristiano Ronaldo (R) failed to register a shot for first time this season in Portugal's 3-0 defeat

Memphis Depay opened the scoring for Holland while Ryan Babel and Virgil van Dijk added the others before Joao Cancelo was sent off for Portugal.

Ronaldo had scored four for Madrid before the international break and he rescued the Euro 2016 champions in the friendly against Egypt last Friday night. 

He netted a brace in stoppage time to seal a 2-1 victory. 

On Monday night Ronaldo was left frustrated against Holland in an international friendly

On Monday night Ronaldo was left frustrated at seeing a penalty appeal rejected after he went down following a challenge from Nathan Ake.

The Portuguese, who scored 19 goals in his previous nine games, was also substituted after 68 minutes.  

Ronaldo will be back in action for his club on Saturday when Madrid travel to Las Palmas in La Liga.

item.title: London mayor Sadiq Khan admits he wants capital to host the Super Bowl
item.description: Sadiq Khan wants London to have an American football franchise and host the Super Bowl. The London mayor has worked closely with the NFL to grow the capital's relationship with the sport.
item.content:encoded:
Sadiq Khan wants London to have an American football franchise and host the Super Bowl.

The London mayor has worked closely with the NFL to grow the capital's relationship with the sport.

London has hosted 21 regular season games since 2007 with Wembley and Tottenham's new White Hart Lane to host a further three later this year. 

Sadiq Khan wants London to have an American football franchise and host the Super Bowl

'I've been saying since the first day I became Mayor my ambition is to have more American football games in London and ultimately for there to be a franchise there and, dare I say it, even the Super Bowl.

'I met recently one of the owners of the Jacksonville Jaguars, Shahid Khan. I've met the NFL commissioner on a number of occasions, most recently at the game at Twickenham this year and my team is working very closely with the NFL.

'This year we'll have three games in our city for a variety of reasons to do with the availability of Twickenham and other issues. 

'Obviously once Spurs open up their stadium that will give us the potential to have more games there, but I'm ambitious - the idea is to have eight games in London eventually, which is the number a franchise team plays and then who knows, maybe one day the Super Bowl.'

The London mayor has worked closely with the NFL to grow the capital's relationship

In 2016 Twickenham hosted a game for the first time and in 2017 two matches were played at the rugby ground as well as at Wembley.

NFL games in London have proved popular with over 1.5 million people attending matches at Wembley alone. 

Tottenham have struck up a 10-year deal to stage two NFL games per season when their new ground opens at the start of next season.

London has hosted 21 regular season games since 2007 at Wembley and Twickenham

Khan added: The Tottenham stadium is going to be remarkable. Daniel Levy took me around and showed me the stadium during its construction phase and I wish them well. 

'It's a stadium that's obviously a football stadium but it's also purpose-built to host some NFL games.'

For London to gain a permanent franchise it would require 75 per cent of the NFL's 32 teams to vote in favour.

item.title: Big Orange will be in shape to run in $1m Dubai Gold Cup despite suffering from 'Set Fast' after cantering, insists trainer Michael Bell
item.description: Trainer Michael Bell says Big Orange will be in shape to run in Saturday's $1million Dubai Gold Cup despite suffering from 'Set Fast' after cantering on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Trainer Michael Bell says Big Orange will be in shape to run in Saturday's $1million Dubai Gold Cup despite suffering from 'Set Fast' after cantering on Monday.

The painful condition, caused by a muscle fibres breaking up and releasing muscle protein into the bloodstream, is the equivalent of cramp in humans. The affected muscles can become stiff and swollen.

Bell said: 'He always gives me the odd hiccup and headache but he should be right by race day.

Big Orange will be fit in time to race in the $1million Dubai Gold Cup on Saturday

'He had a little Set Fast after exercise this morning but I hope it is a storm in a teacup.

'It was his first canter since he got there and slightly out of character. Normally horses recover quite quickly.'

Saturday will be the third time 2017 Ascot Gold Cup winner Big Orange has run in the Dubai Gold Cup, one of the feature races of Dubai World Cup day.

The seven-year-old was second to Vazirabad in 2016 and fourth to the same horse last year when the rain-affected ground went against him.

Big Orange suffered 'Set Fast' which is the equivalent of muscle cramps in humans

Bell is keen to target Big Orange at the new £1million Weatherbys Hamilton bonus for stayers launched on Monday.

To win the £1m, a horse must win one race from Ascot's Sagaro Stakes, Chester's Ormonde Stakes, Sandown's Henry II Stakes, and York's Yorkshire Cup and then go on to win the Ascot Gold Cup, Goodwood Cup and Lonsdale Stakes at York.

Frankie Dettori rides Big Orange on Saturday. He is still retained by Sheik Joaan Al Thani's Al Shaqab organisation but a reflection of their diminishing interest in British racing and focus on their French interests has come with the announcement that British racing manager Harry Herbert will stand down next month.

Cue Card, the dual Cheltenham Festival scorer and 2015 King George VI Chase winner, will be retired after running in the bet365 Oaksey Chase on the final day of the jumps season, April 28, at Sandown. The Colin Tizzard-trained 12-year-old was pulled up in the Ryanair Chase at the Cheltenham Festival.

item.title: The Ryder Cup to return to Hazeltine National in 2028 as Minnesota venue becomes first American course to host the illustrious event for a second time
item.description: The Ryder Cup will return to Hazeltine National in 2028, the PGA of America has announced. The Minnesota layout will become the first American venue to host the biennial event twice.
item.content:encoded:
The Ryder Cup will return to Hazeltine National in 2028, the PGA of America has announced.

The Minnesota layout hosted the last Ryder Cup in 2016 when the United States lifted the trophy for the first time since 2008 and will become the first American venue to host the biennial event twice.

"Hazeltine - site of the US Ryder Cup team's 17-11 victory in 2016 - will become the first American venue to host a second Ryder Cup," read a statement on www.pga.com.

The Ryder Cup will return to Hazeltine National in 2028, the PGA of America has announced

European captain Thomas Bjorn and American counterpart Jim Furyk will lead their teams at Le Golf National in Paris later in the year as Europe aim to win a sixth consecutive contest on home soil.

Europe were comprehensively beaten 18 months ago after losing the first session 4-0, with Thomas Pieters' four points as a rookie the only shining light.

Whistling Straits will host the next Ryder Cup on American soil, before it moves to Marco Simone Golf and Country Club in Italy in 2022 and Bethpage Black in 2024.

It also played host in 2016 when the Americans lifted the trophy for the first time since 2008

The Minnesota layout will become the first American venue to host the biennial event twice

The European venues for 2026 and 2030 are yet to be decided but the Olympic Club in San Francisco will play host in 2032.

Hazeltine has previously hosted two US Opens, two US PGA Championships, two US Women's Opens and a US Senior Open.

The PGA of America accompanied the announcement with a video on their Ryder Cup social media feeds featuring the recent gold-medal winning men's Olympic curling team.

The Minnesota layout hosted the last Ryder Cup in 2016 when the United States lifted the trophy for the first time since 2008 and will become the first American venue to host the biennial event twice. Europe were comprehensively beaten 18 months ago after losing the first session 4-0, with Thomas Pieters' four points as a rookie the only shining light.

item.title: Massimiliano Allegri declares his commitment to Juventus despite summer links with Chelsea and PSG
item.description: Fifty-year-old Italian Allegri is one of the most sought after managers in world football after winning a hat-trick of Serie A titles and reaching two Champions League finals in the past three seasons.
item.content:encoded:
Juventus manager Massimiliano Allegri has insisted that he is happy where he is amid speculation linking him with Chelsea and PSG.

The 50-year-old is one of the most sought-after managers in world football after winning a hat-trick of Serie A titles and reaching two Champions League finals in the past three seasons.

Chelsea and PSG are both considering a change this summer, with the futures of Antonio Conte and Unai Emery far from certain.

Fifty-year-old Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri has insisted that he is happy to stay in Turin

Manager Allegri has been linked with possible vacancies at PSG and Chelsea this summer

Allegri has been cited as an ideal candidate to fill one of the potential vacancies in London or Paris, but he has moved to declare his commitment to Juve.

'Everything is tied to results,' Allegri told Premium Sport.

'If you win you're good, if you lose you're less good. I have a contract until 2020 and I'm happy here.' 

Allegri was speaking at an awards ceremony on Monday after winning the Panchina d'Oro (Golden Bench) prize for being the best manager in Serie A last year.

Juve are on course to win another Serie A title — the club's seventh in a row —  this season as they lead Napoli by two points with nine games remaining.

Allegri's side host his former club AC Milan — with whom he won the 2010-11 Serie A title — on Saturday, before taking on Real Madrid in the first leg of a Champions League quarter-final three days later.

But he said at an awards ceremony this week: 'I have a contract until 2020 and I'm happy here'

item.title: Gareth Bale promises Wales will be ready for Euro 2020 qualification campaign under Ryan Giggs
item.description: Wales had to settle for the runners-up spot in the China Cup after Edinson Cavani's second-half strike gave Uruguay a 1-0 victory on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Gareth Bale promised Wales would be ready for the 2020 European Championship campaign after their China Cup disappointment.

Wales had to settle for the runners-up spot in Nanning after Edinson Cavani's second-half strike gave Uruguay a 1-0 victory on Monday.

The two China Cup games were new manager Ryan Giggs' first in charge, and Wales only have a May friendly against Mexico in Pasadena before the serious business of the inaugural League of Nations starts.

Gareth Bale promised Wales would be ready for the 2020 European Championship campaign

Bale aims a shot at goal during Wales' 1-0 defeat by Uruguay in the final of the China Cup

Wales are in a group with Denmark and the Republic of Ireland in the autumn, those matches preceding the European Championship qualifiers which start next March.

'Ultimately we're disappointed, we thought they were there for the taking,' Bale told Welsh football programme Sgorio after the game.

'But when the major games come around in the qualifiers we'll be ready.

'It's been important having the new manager in and everybody settling down, getting to know his ways.

'Obviously new players are coming in and there's a lot of positives to take out of it.

Edinson Cavani makes no mistake from close range after Christian Rodriguez's square pass

Cavani celebrates in typical style after giving Uruguay the victory against Wales

'I think it'll stand us in good stead for the future and I'm sure we'll win many more games.'

Giggs had started his reign with a 6-0 thumping of tournament hosts China, with Bale claiming a hat-trick to become Wales' record goalscorer.

But Uruguay were always going to present a far more formidable test with Cavani and Luis Suarez linking so well at the focal point of their attack.

'They've got midfielders who are very good players who can handle the ball,' Giggs said.

'So what we tried to do was not let them play at their own rhythm, try and put pressure on the ball and stop at it source, not get it to Cavani and Suarez because of the quality they possess.

Bale aims a shot at goal during the first-half in Nanning as Diego Laxalt watches on

'Sometimes you're not going to do it, and it's about being solid and defending. I thought we did it well.

'Of course, against teams like that you're going to ride your luck but they showed us the utmost respect.'

Giggs took the opportunity to blood several youngsters in the second half, and Connor Roberts and Billy Bodin both made debuts.

'I'm really pleased with the depth of the squad,' Giggs said.

'You look at Uruguay and they have a lot of quality and depth, perhaps we haven't got that as much as other teams.

'But I'm really happy with a lot of players from this tour, not only in the games but what they've shown in training.'

item.title: Huddersfield sack coach Rick Stone just seven games into new season as assistant Chris Thorman takes over
item.description: Huddersfield's Rick Stone has become the first Betfred Super League coaching casualty of the season with assistant Chris Thorman taking over the reins.
item.content:encoded:
Huddersfield's Rick Stone has become the first Betfred Super League coaching casualty of the season.

The 51-year-old Australian has been sacked by the Giants just two months into the season with the team next to bottom of the table after winning just two of their opening seven matches.

Stone, formerly with Newcastle Knights in the NRL, succeeded Paul Anderson at the John Smith's Stadium in the summer of 2016 and his contract was up at the end of this season.

Huddersfield's Rick Stone has departed his role at the Giants after a poor run of form

Assistant coach Chris Thorman has been placed in temporary charge ahead of Friday's home game against champions Leeds.

Giants' managing director Richard Thewlis said: 'It is a very difficult call for any club to make in respect of the head coach but the board felt that a change was needed and that the change should be made sooner rather than later with much of the season still to run.'

Stone was unable to prevent Huddersfield from finishing in the bottom four in 2016 but guided them to safety via the Super 8s Qualifiers and last season steered them to a top-eight finish.

However, they are once more deep in trouble, having lost 38-6 at home to promoted Hull KR in their last home game, and they conceded nine tries in a 48-10 hammering at Wigan last Friday.

Assistant coach Chris Thorman (left, pictured during his playing days) has taken over the reins
